---
title: Atlas Migration Plan
id: plan
slug: /hcl/plan
---



## `plan` {#plan}
The `plan` block defines a schema migration for a transition between two schema states.

~~~hcl
plan "20240806145620" {
  # Hashes generated by the 'atlas schema plan new' command.
  from      = "SMKH4vp9zdHDtpr9NrB4Li3n8x0meA3QrnRdJZuDQDM="
  to        = "oCvOMG7NOE+XUz04UA674zNYVdrN3qoFkJDZPKLPGA0="
  # Actual migratio.
  migration = <<-SQL
  -- Migration content goes here.
  SQL
}
~~~



### Attributes {#plan-attributes}



<table class="attributes-table">
  <tr>
    <th>Name and description</th>
    <th>Required</th>
    <th>Value</th>
  </tr>
  <tr>
<td id="plan.from" class="no-margin-bottom"><p><a href="#plan.from"><code>from</code></a></p>

Hash of the current schema state computed by Atlas
</td>
    <td><code>true</code></td>
  <td><code>string</code></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
<td id="plan.migration" class="no-margin-bottom"><p><a href="#plan.migration"><code>migration</code></a></p>

The actual migration statements. For example:

~~~hcl
migration = <<-SQL
-- Migration content goes here.
SQL
~~~

</td>
    <td><code>true</code></td>
  <td><code>string</code></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
<td id="plan.to" class="no-margin-bottom"><p><a href="#plan.to"><code>to</code></a></p>

Hash of the desired schema state computed by Atlas
</td>
    <td><code>true</code></td>
  <td><code>string</code></td>
  </tr>
</table>




### Constraints {#plan-constraints}



|    Constraint               |           Value
|-----------------------------|------------------------------------
| Required                    |      `true`
| Require Name                |      `true`
| Allow Qualifier             |      `false`
| Repeatable                  |      `false`
| Allow unknown blocks        |      `false`
| Allow unknown attributes    |      `false`
